Title: Day before receiving Dronacharya Award^ athletics coach Purushotham Rai passes away
Summary: Senior athletics coach Purushotham Rai died on Friday^ a day ahead ofNational Sports Awards wherein he was set to receive the Dronacharya Award.

Title: Asian Games champion Vinesh Phogat tests positive for coronavirus

Title: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe could always be trusted: IOC chief Thomas Bach

Title: Mumbai court extends Sachin Vaze's NIA custody till April 7
Summary: A local court in Mumbai extended suspended Mumbai Police Sachin Vaze's NIAcustody till April 7 on Saturday.

Title: BJP works for everyone^ some parties divide the country for vote banks: PM Modi in Assam
Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Tamulpur ahead of the finalphase of Assam assembly elections. PM Modi said that the Bharatiya JanataParty (BJP) works for everyone^ whereas some parties divide the country fortheir vote banks.PM Modi further assured the public that the government at the Centre and inthe state is working to fully implement the Assam Accord. Watch the video toknow more

Title: Chhattisgarh: 5 jawans^ 2 Naxals killed in Bijapur encounter
Summary: Five jawans and two Naxals were killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh'sBijapur district today. The deceased jawans belonged to the CRPF and DRG.

Title: Bengal Face-off: PM Modi^ CM Mamata Banerjee to address rallies in Hooghly
Summary: Ahead of the third phase of West Bengal assembly elections^ Prime MinisterNarendra Modi and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee are set to holdrallies in Bengal's Hooghly district on Saturday.Mamata Banerjee will address a rally at 1:30pm in Hooghly’s Tarakeswarconstituency. Meanwhile^  Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be addressingthe crowd in Hooghly’s Haripal constituency at around 2:45 pm. BharatiyaJanata Party (BJP) is fielding journalist-turned-neta Swapan Dasgupta whereasTrinamool Congress (TMC) has named Ramendu Singha Roy as its candidate fromTarakeswar. Watch the video for more.

Title: Antilia bomb scare case: NIA court seeks medical report of suspended cop Sachin Vaze
Summary: After suspended assistant police inspector Sachin Vaze’s legal team filedan application before the NIA court regarding his health condition^ the courthas now asked for his medical reports. Vaze is the prime accused in theAntilia bomb scare and Mansukh Hiren murder cases.

Title: Tamil Nadu polls: Amit Shah holds mega roadshow in Chennai seeking votes for Khushbu Sundar
Summary: Ahead of the assembly election in Tamil Nadu^ Union Home Minister Amit Shahon Saturday held a mega roadshow in Chennai. He sought votes for BharatiyaJanata Party (BJP) candidate Khushbu Sundar^ who switched over from theCongress to BJP last year.BJP supporters flanked Amit Shah’s rally in huge numbers. The saffron partyis contesting elections in Tamil Nadu in alliance with the ruling AIADMK. Formore^ watch the full video.

Title: Why isn’t US talking about what’s happening in India? : Rahul Gandhi questions
Summary: In a conversation with Ambassador Nicholas Burns from Harvard Kennedy School^Congress leader Rahul Gandhi asked why is the US not saying anything aboutwhat is happening in India. Accusing the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) ofcapturing institutions in India^ Rahul Gandhi said democracy in the countryis "dead".Amit Malviya^ BJP IT Cell head responded to Rahul Gandhi’s question andsaid that India today is in a position where it does not need intervention bya third-party in its internal affairs.Watch the video to know more.

Title: India records 89^129 new Covid-19 cases^ highest in 6 months
Summary: India reported 89^129 new Covid-19 cases and 714 deaths in the last 24 hours^according to the Union Health Ministry. This is the highest single-day risein cases since September 2020.As the second wave of the pandemic rages on in the country^ several statesare putting in place curbs and restrictions to control the spread of thevirus. Maharashtra on Friday reported 47^827 new cases. With the surge in Covid-19cases^ Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that newset of restrictions^ maybe even a lockdown^ will be imposed in the state ifthe situation persists. Watch the video to know more.

Title: Andhra CM's bail can be cancelled anytime^ says BJP's Sunil Deodhar as Tirupati bypoll nears
Summary: The bye-election to Tirupati parliamentary constituency is slated for April17 with BJP fielding a former bureaucrat as its candidate against CM JaganMohan Reddy's YSRCP.

Title: Why Nemom in Kerala is a keenly-watched seat in assembly polls
Summary: Nemom^ a suburb of Thiruvananthapuram and one of the 140 assembly seats inKerala^ has become one of the most keenly-watched seats in the state assemblypolls.Nemom is one of the few seats in Kerala where the two dominant social groups^the Nairs and Ezhavas^ constitute about 50 per cent of the electorate.According to national election surveys of the Centre for the Study ofDeveloping Societies (CSDS)^ sections of the Nairs and the Ezhavas haveshifted towards the BJP in recent elections.All three principal contenders - the United Democratic Front (UDF)^ The LeftDemocratic Front (LDF) and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) - have fieldedNair candidates this time.Watch the video to know more.

Title: President Kovind shifted from ICU^ recovering well after bypass surgery
Summary: President Ram Nath Kovind was shifted from the ICU to a special room at theAIIMS hospital on Saturday. The Rashtrapati Bhavan said on Saturday thatPresident Kovind’s health has been improving since his bypass surgery onMarch 30.

Title: BJP chief Nadda says Mamata Banerjee losing from Nandigram^ looking for alternative seat
Summary: Ahead of the third phase of assembly elections in Assam and West Bengal^Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Chief JP Nadda targeted Trinamool Congress (TMC)Chief Mamata Banerjee. She is going to lose from Nandigram and is looking fora second seat^ said Nadda.The BJP Chief also attacked Congress over Assam polls and said that the partyhad betrayed Assam and ignored development in the state.Watch the full video here.

Title: Class 10 girl returning from tuition abducted^ gang-raped in Meerut^ kills self
Summary: A Class 10 student in Meerut was abducted and gang-raped while she wasreturning from a tuition class. Later^ the girl died by suicide and left anote naming the accused.

Summary: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the attack onfarm leader Rakesh Tikait's convoy by "members of the BJP" in Alwar districtof the state was condemnable.

Title: India can provide food^ medicine but won't encourage infiltration: Amit Shah on Myanmar crisis
Summary: In an exclusive interview to India Today TV^ Home Minister and BJP loyalistAmit Shah on Friday said the Government of India can provide food and medicalsupplies^ however^ it won't encourage illegal infiltration into the country."We want to help everyone. If they [people of Myanmar] want ration or medicalsupplies^ the Indian government can set up camps and help them. But we can'tencourage illegal infiltration into India from Myanmar^" Amit Shah said. Theongoing crisis in Myanmar^ since the beginning of the coup^ has claimed morethan 114 lives^ according to a report by the Associated Press. For more^watch the full video.

Title: Researchers in Maharashtra name new plant species after Sharad Pawar
Summary: A new species of flowering plants has been spotted in south Maharashtra'sKolhapur district and named after NCP chief Sharad Pawar.

Title: India reports 81^466 new coronavirus cases^ highest single-day rise of 2021
Summary: The coronavirus tally in India has mounted to 1^23^03^131 after 81^466 newinfections were reported in a span of 24 hours - the highest single-day risein cases since October 2^ 2020 - according to the Union Health Ministry data.The fresh cases were reported from eight states namely Maharashtra^ Gujarat^Rajasthan^ Uttar Pradesh^ West Bengal^ Karnataka^ Madhya Pradesh and Kerala.To more know about the Covid surge in India^ watch the full video.

Title: Drug raids: NCB arrests two from Mumbai
Summary: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) arrested two persons^ including a foreignnational^ during raids in Navi Mumbai and Mumbai on Thursday.

Title: Model^ beauty queen Diksha Singh to contest UP panchayat poll

Title: Maharashtra can go into lockdown if ongoing coronavirus situation remains same: CM Uddhav Thackeray
Summary: As the number of coronavirus cases continue to soar up in the state^Maharashtra Chief Minister and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Fridaysaid if the Covid-19 situation remains the same^ Maharashtra can get intoanother lockdown. “Lot of experts have come with their suggestions. Somesaid they will oppose the lockdown^ a lockdown is not an option^ transfermoney to those who will lose jobs. An industrialist has also said that ratherthan lockdown^ why can't government improve health facilities. I just haveone request to these people^ bring doctors for me. Bring me people^ who willwork for these facilities^” the CM said. For more^ watch the full video.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Ban on firecrackers brings losses for Sivakasi^ locals share plight
Summary: The ban on firecrackers has taken a toll on the fireworks' industry inSivakasi^ the firework manufacturing hub of India located in the Virudhunagardistrict of Tamil Nadu. For more^watch the full video.

Summary: Speaking to India Today TV^ Amit Shah said India is ready to provide food andmedicines to the people of Myanmar but can't encourage infiltration.

Summary: The NIA summoned a woman to its office for questioning in the Sachin Vazecase^ on Friday. The probe agency suspects she was the woman who accompaniedSachin Vaze to a posh Mumbai hotel on February 16.

Title: No country for 'Covidiot': How people are flouting coronavirus norms
Summary: The term ‘COVIDIOT ‘ is trending on Twitter. If you do not know what itmeans^ do not worry^ we are here to get update you. It is when someone whoignores the warnings regarding public health or safety^ or^ a person whohoards goods^ denying them from their neighbours. COVIDIOT is a mix of twoterms: Covid-19 and idiot. There many in the country who are aggressivelyflouting Covid-19 guidelines. Many were caught on camera at Andhra temple^others at Dadar. For more^ watch the full video.

Title: Delhi Covid-19 cases surge^ AAP govt plans stricter measures
Summary: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said the capital is witnessingthe "fourth wave" of coronavirus^ however^ the AAP government is not planningto impose a lockdown for now. But stricter measures will be taken to containthe spread of the contagious virus. For more^ watch the full video.

Title: Bombay high court quashes FIR against former judge’s son

Gujarat Assembly passes bill penalising forcible conversions by marriage

Summary: Although Rajinikanth has now moved to playing roles his age but he is stillthe demigod of Tamil cinema.

Title: Fact Check: Two-year-old Left Front rally in Kolkata shared as Feb 28 gathering
Summary: This image of a sea of people is going viral on social media with the claimthat is from Sunday’s joint rally of Left Front and Congress in Kolkata’sBrigade Parade Ground ahead of the 2021 Bengal assembly elections. IndiaToday's AFWA probes the truth.

Title: Fact Check: No^ it’s not mandatory for users to verify their social media accounts within 3 months
Summary: A viral post on social media claims that in accordance with the newguidelines^ within three months^ all social media accounts need to beverified with a government ID. However^ the government has only asked thesocial media platforms to provide an appropriate mechanism for users who wishto verify their accounts voluntarily.

Title: Fact Check: Know the real story behind this vintage spring wheel bicycle
Summary: An image of a vintage bicycle with unique spring wheels and a rifle attachedto it is viral with the claim that it is from the British period. India TodayAnti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that this is a German bicycle thatwas used in World War I.

Title: Fact Check: No^ the Indian national flag is not banned inside Gujarat's Narendra Modi Stadium
Summary: A video showing a group of cricket fans alleging that they were not allowedto take the Indian national flag inside the Motera Stadium is viral on socialmedia. It is being said that the Tricolour has been banned in the stadiumwhich is named after the PM.

Title: Fact Check: Viral image of petrol bill asking not to vote for PM Modi is fake
Summary: An image of a petrol bill purportedly by an 'HPL' dealer named Sai BalajiPetroleum in Mumbai’s Vikhroli is viral on social media. The text alongwith the image asks readers to not vote for Prime Minister Narendra Modi thenext time if they want reduced petrol prices.

Title: Fact Check: Five-year-old picture of unrest passed off as recent clashes in Srinagar
Summary: A picture of masked youths pelting stones started circulating on social mediawith the claim that clashes erupted at Srinagar’s Batmaloo area during acordon and search operation (CASO) recently. India Today's AFWA probes thetruth.

Title: Fact Check: 2018 video of Varanasi flyover collapse shared with misleading claims
Summary: A short clip showing several vehicles with passengers inside crushed under aconcrete slab is circulating on social media with different claims. Whilesome say the video was taken after the under-constructionBalanagar-Jeedimetla flyover in Hyderabad collapsed^ others say it is arecent incident from Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Fact Check: Viral video of Meerut man spitting on rotis shared as incident from Hyderabad
Summary: A disturbing video shows a man spitting on rotis while cooking at Red RosePalace function hall in Hyderabad’s Nampally area.

Title: Fact Check: This video of BJP workers attacking a house is not from Bengal
Summary: The viral video of BJP workers pelting stones and furniture at a house is notfrom Bengal^ but Telangana.

Title: Fact Check: Picture of BJP workers forming human flag is not from Yogi’s rally in Kerala
Summary: A picture of a large gathering of people forming the BJP symbol lotus isbeing circulated on social media linking it to the BJP’s “Vijay Yatra”in Kasaragod district of poll-bound Kerala.

Title: Fact Check Video: No^ this green flag in a Congress rally is not a Pakistani flag
Summary: An image of a green flag being waved in a political rally has gone viral witha claim that it is the Pakistani national flag waved during a Congress rally.Multiple users have shared this image on Facebook. The caption in Hindi toone such claim translates as^ “It is far better to bear the extra cost ofpetrol rather than voting to a party that raises anti-India slogans and wavesPakistani flags in their rallies.”The claim comes in the backdrop of rising fuel prices across the country.Watch this video to know more.

Title: Fact Check: These are not RSS workers dragged through the streets of Kerala by Popular Front
Summary: A short clip of a group of Muslims marching two men in RSS uniforms iscirculating on social media with the claim that Popular Front of India (PFI)activists in Kerala’s Muslim-majority Malappuram district chained andparaded Sangh workers publicly through the streets.

Title: Fact Check: Rescue operation in Uttarakhand shared as Indian Army destroying Chinese bunkers
Summary: A one-minute video is viral on social media with the claim that it shows theIndian Army removing the Chinese bunkers from the banks of Pangong Tso Lake.India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim alongwith the video is misleading.

Title: Fact Check: No^ this green flag in a Congress rally is not a Pakistani flag
Summary: An image that shows the Pakistani national flag being waved during a Congressrally is being shared widely by social media users.

Title: Fact Check: Web series shoot passed off as terrorists nabbed in Mumbai
Summary: India Today's AFWA probes a video which reportedly shows police arresting agroup of terrorists from the Pydhonie area of South Mumbai.

Title: Fact Check: This is not Nirmala Sitharaman with Jayalalithaa in vintage pic
Summary: A black-and-white image of J Jayalalithaa along with another woman has goneviral with the claim that this is a rare picture of the former Tamil Naduchief minister and Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

Title: Fact Check: Picture of Greta Thunberg having food in front of poor kids is morphed
Summary: Amid the ongoing toolkit case^ an image showing Swedish climate activistGreta Thunberg^ eating luxuriously in front of poor and starving children hasgone viral on social media. The image is being shared with the trendinghashtag #AskGretaWhy.

Title: Fact Check: Fake West Bengal election schedule circulates on social media
Summary: A post circulating on social media claims that the election schedule for WestBengal has been announced. The upcoming assembly elections will be held inseven phases between April 1 and May 17.

Title: Fact Check: These are not Bajrang Dal members in UP demanding repeal of farm laws
Summary: The picture is of a Shiv Sena protest in Maharashtra’s Hingoli district onFebruary 5 against fuel price hike.

Title: Fact Check: This story about a treasure trove in Kashmir has an Italian connection
Summary: A picture of a broken container lying in mud and filth but filled with goldcoins is circulating on social media. The story along with the picture saysthe coins were discovered by a labourer while digging a canal near Wular lakein Jammu and Kashmir. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has foundthat the picture is not from India but the Italian town of Como.

Title: Fact Check: Image of traffic jam in China shared as German protest against fuel price hike
Summary: A picture of a massive traffic jam in China’s Shenzhen city in 2012 hasgone viral as German protest against the fuel price hike.

Title: Fact Check: These pictures of farmers’ protest in Berlin are over a year old
Summary: Amid the ongoing farmers’ protest in India^ a set of three pictures showingseveral tractors parked on the roads in long lines has gone viral on socialmedia with the claim that these are visuals from a recent farmers’demonstration in Berlin.

Title: Fact Check: Bhagat Singh^ Sukhdev and Rajguru were not sentenced to death on February 14
Summary: February 14 is not just Valentine's Day. On this day in 1931^ Bhagat Singh^Sukhdev and Rajguru were sentenced to death in Lahore^ some social mediausers are claiming.

Title: Fact Check: Old images from Turkey shared as damage caused by earthquake in Afghanistan
Summary: A set of three images showing people standing amid the debris of a collapsedbuilding is being circulated with claims that these are scenes from therecent earthquake in Afghanistan. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA)has found that the claim along with the images is misleading.

Title: Fact Check: No^ these earthquake destruction scenes are not from Tajikistan
Summary: A day after a strong earthquake jolted Tajikistan in central Asia^ twopictures of critically damaged buildings have gone viral on social media. Itis being said that the pictures are from Tajikistan^ taken after theearthquake struck the country.

Title: Fact check video: Picture of housing project in Bangladesh shared as Mamata’s scheme for slum dwellers
Summary: The picture of a housing project in Bangladesh shared as Mamata’s schemefor slum dwellers.

Title: Fact Check: This is not Amulya^ the girl who raised ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ slogans in 2020^ at the farmers' protest
Summary: Amulya Leona Noronha^ a journalism student studying in Bengaluru^ wasarrested on February 20^ 2020^ when she had stood on a stage and raised“Pakistan zindabad” slogans during a speech.

Title: Fact Check: Picture of housing project in Bangladesh shared as Mamata’s scheme for slum dwellers
Summary: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with thepicture to be misleading.

Title: Fact Check: Delhi HC has not ordered release of protesters held during farmers’ agitation
Summary: A viral message on social media claims that the Delhi high court has orderedrelease of all protesters held by Delhi Police during the ongoing farmers’movement.

Title: Fact Check: The man who was playing double role of Naseeruddin Shah and Rakesh Tikait on Twitter
Summary: A Twitter handle^ "@naseruddin_shah"^ had nearly 60^000 followers before itwas first deleted on the evening of January 9^ and then put up again.Incidentally^ this handle was earlier impersonating farmer leader RakeshTikait and tweeting pro-farmer and anti-government posts. Read on to know thetruth behind the Twitter account.

Title: Fact Check: Undertaker would rise from the dead after this morphed tweet in support of farmers
Summary: A screenshot of a tweet supporting the farmers’ protest^ which looks likeit was posted from the verified handle of Undertaker^ has gone viral onsocial media. The image shows the wrestler holding a placard saying“LET’S TEAM UP!” India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has foundthat the text in the screenshot is morphed.

Title: Fact Check Video: Was Sharad Pawar slapped in public for his statement on Tendulkar?
Summary: A short clip of Sharad Pawar getting slapped by a man in public iscirculating on social media after Pawar had asked Tendulkar to “exercisecaution while speaking about any other field”.

Title: Is this video of liquor distribution from farmers’ protest?
Summary: A short clip of a person sitting inside a vehicle and distributing alcohol isbeing widely circulated on social media. It is being said this is a scenefrom the ongoing farmers' protest. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA)has found the claim to be misleading. Watch the video to know more.

Title: Fact Check: NASA has nothing to do with this edited image of the sun’s surface
Summary: A stunning picture apparently showing the sun’s dazzling surface is viralon social media with the claim that it was published by the NationalAeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

Title: Fact Check: Was Sharad Pawar slapped in public for his statement on Tendulkar?
Summary: A short clip of Sharad Pawar getting slapped by a man in public iscirculating on social media after Pawar had asked Tendulkar to “exercisecaution while speaking about any other field”.

Title: Fact Check: Avalanche video from Nepal shared as Uttarakhand glacier burst
Summary: A video of a huge mass of snow sliding down a mountain is being circulated onsocial media with the claim that it shows the glacier burst inUttarakhand’s Chamoli on Sunday.

Title: Fact Check: This emotional post about a farmer and his soldier son is misleading
Summary: A set of images are going viral on social media with the claim that soonafter getting leave^ a soldier rushed to Delhi border to meet his father^ whohas been protesting against the farm laws for 75 days.

Title: Fact Check: This video of liquor distribution is not from farmers’ protest
Summary: A video has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows freealcohol distribution among farmers protesting against the three farm laws.AFWA probes the truth.

Title: Fact Check: This viral tweet on ‘Hindu Mukt India’ by Bollywood singer is fake
Summary: A screenshot of a communally charged tweet purportedly by Indian playbacksinger Caralisa Monteiro is viral on social media that declares India will be“Hindu Mukt” soon.

Title: Fact Check: Morphed photo shows Congress workers offering cake to Mia Khalifa's poster
Summary: An image showing a group of Congress party workers offering cake to Khalifa'sposter is viral on social media. The caption to one such image reads^ "Somuch enslaved mentality? Height of Appeasement... uff.. the Congi Way !@INCIndia most effective n anti India ideology!?"

Title: Fact Check: List of UP Congress' minority cell members viral with communal twist
Summary: A post circulating on social media claims that the Congress party in UttarPradesh did not appoint even a single district chairman from the Hinducommunity.

Title: Fact Check: Video of Nihang Sikhs attacking bus is not related to farmers’ protest
Summary: A video showing a group of Nihang Sikhs arguing with a bus driver andattacking the bus with swords is viral on social media. It is being claimedthat it is a scene from the ongoing farmers’ protest.

Title: Fact Check: This is not a widowed professor carrying his baby to class
Summary: Several Twitter users have shared a collage^ claiming that these are picturesof a professor who lost his wife during childbirth and is taking care of hischild while taking classes. AFWA probes the truth.

Title: Fact Check: These antique steel-wheeled tractors have no connection with farmers’ protests
Summary: Old photos of vintage tractors are being circulated with claims farmers arepreparing tractors with steel wheels to overcome nails and spikes installednear protest sites.

Title: Fact Check: This article praising PM Modi was not published by ‘The New York Times’
Summary: An article eulogising Prime Minister Narendra Modi^ said to be written by theeditor-in-chief of “The New York Times”^ is being widely circulated onsocial media. AFWA probes the truth.

Title: Fact Check: This was not the rush at Borivali station after local trains resumed in Mumbai
Summary: A video going viral on social media claims to shows the crowd at Mumbai’sBorivali station on February 1^ the day suburban trains resumed for thegeneral public after a 10-month gap. AFWA probes the truth.

Title: Fact Check: Viral video of Japan’s lightning-fast electric train is not real
Summary: A video of a train ride is being shared on social media along with the claimthat the new electric train in Japan is twice as fast as an F-16 fighteraircraft.

Title: Fact Check: This image of men in police gear and civil clothes is not linked to farmers’ stir
Summary: A post circulating on social media claims that a group of men in civil dress^donning helmets and other protective gear usually worn by law enforcementagencies are deployed by Delhi Police at farmers’ protest. India Today AntiFake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.

Title: Fact Check: Pro-Khalistan rally in San Francisco passed off as farmers’ agitation in India
Summary: An image of a man holding a placard against the Ram temple has gone viralwith the claim that it was taken during the ongoing farmers’ agitation.

Title: Fact Check: No boyfriend^ no entry? These college circulars are too filmy to be true
Summary: Posts going viral on social media claim that the SRM Institute of Science andTechnology^ Chennai^ and St. John’s College^ Agra^ have issued circularsmaking it mandatory for female students to have a boyfriend.

Title: Fact Check: No^ 200 policemen in Delhi haven't resigned in support of farmers
Summary: A post circulating on social media claims that 200 policemen in Delhi havetendered mass resignation in solidarity with the protesting farmers. IndiaToday Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.

Title: Fact Check: Unrelated image shared as police action against protesting farmers
Summary: According to the reports^ the picture is from the violence that broke out atthe tractor rally on Republic Day.

Title: Fact Check: Video of water tanker hitting women en route farmers' protest has no political connection
Summary: A video has gone viral with a claim that in a moment of rage^ a BJP officialhit some women with a water tanker and ran over them^ when they were on theirway to participate in the farmers’ protest march in Delhi.

Title: Fact Check: Seven-year-old image from UP wrongly linked to farmers’ agitation
Summary: An image of a man wearing a Modi t-shirt attacking police personnel has goneviral. The image has been linked to the ongoing farmers’ protest. IndiaToday Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) found that the viral image isseven-year-old and is from Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Fact Check: This video of police damaging CCTV is not linked to January 26 tractor rally
Summary: The tractor rallies organised in Delhi on January 26 by farmers against thethree farm laws had turned violent^ resulting in clashes between protestersand police.

Title: Fact Check: Dr Kafeel Khan was not part of tractor rally in Delhi on Republic Day
Summary: A picture of Dr Kafeel Khan on a tractor is being widely circulated on socialmedia with the claim that he was part of the January 26 tractor rally inDelhi. Khan was an accused in the Gorakhpur infant deaths case.

Title: Fact Check: Pulwama attack protest pictures shared as January 26 tractor rally violence
Summary: A set of images showing cars on fire is viral on social media with the claimthat these are scenes from the protest. India Today Anti Fake News War Roomhas found the claim to be misleading.

Title: Fact Check: Video of cops pursuing sand mafia passed off as UP police chasing farmer
Summary: A video of Uttarakhand Police chasing a man allegedly involved in illegalsand mining is being wrongly circulated as Uttar Pradesh Police chasing afarmer on his way to Delhi to participate in the January 26 tractor rally.

Title: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi did not suggest replacing Indian Army with labourers at China border
Summary: A video of Rahul Gandhi speaking at a public meeting in Tamil Nadu is viralon social media with the claim that the Congress leader suggested replacingthe Indian Army with labourers^ farmers and workers at the volatile Chinaborder.

Title: Fact Check: Truth of the flag hoisted at Red Fort by protesting farmers
Summary: Calling it a Black Day for India^ several Twitter and Facebook usersclaimed that the Khalistani flag was raised at Red Fort. India Today AntiFake News War Room (AFWA) has found that it was not a Khalistani flag but theNishan Sahib^ a religious flag of Sikhs^ which was raised at Red Fort.

Title: Edited clip of Mamata reciting Islamic prayers linked to Netaji event controversy
Summary: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral clip isthree years old. In that event^ Mamata did recite Islamic verses^ but she hadalso recited Hindu^ Christian and Sikh prayers.

Title: Fact Check: Edited clip of Mamata reciting Islamic prayers linked to Netaji event controversy
Summary: Amid row over West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee refusing to give her speech atan event in honour of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose over chants of 'Jai ShriRam'^ a video is going viral on social media which shows the chief ministerleading Islamic prayers. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.

Title: These officials posing for Covid-19 vaccine is not what it looks like
Summary: A Fact Check video by India Today's DIU teams shows that these officialsposing for coronavirus vaccine is not what it looks like. For more^ watch thefull video.

Title: Fact Check: Decade-old image of Friday namaz at US Capitol Hill viral with misleading claims
Summary: Social media users are sharing an image showing a Friday namaz held at thefoot of US Capitol Hill after Joe Biden became the US President.

Title: Fact Check: WhatsApp isn't recording your calls but privacy concerns can't be ruled out yet
Summary: A message is going viral on social media which makes several startling claimsrelated to WhatsApp's new privacy-related terms and policies.

Title: Fact Check: Biden didn’t ignore India; foreign leaders are not invited to US Presidential inauguration
Summary: A viral post on social media claims that Biden invited all of India’sneighbours for his inaugural ceremony^ however^ India was not invited to theevent.

Title: UP madrasas ordered shut for not celebrating R-Day?
Summary: A viral message on social media claims that the Yogi Adityanath government inUttar Pradesh will shut down madrasas which do not celebrate Republic Day onJanuary 26. But is that true? Watch the video to know the truth.

Title: Fact Check: These officials posing for Covid-19 vaccine is not what it looks like
Summary: A video in which a man and a woman are seen posing for vaccination picturesis circulating on social media with the claim that officials in Karnataka’sTumkur are faking it for the cameras while pretending to take Covid-19vaccines.

Title: Fact Check: This Trump letter needling Biden on election victory is fake
Summary: A farewell note apparently written by Donald Trump to Joe Biden before hevacated the Oval Office is doing the rounds on social media.

Title: Fact Check: Morphed images of Thailand floods inundate social media
Summary: Social media users are sharing images that show clear blue flood waters inThailand’s Pattani province.

Title: Fact Check: Bill Gates never said Covid vaccines will kill or disable 7 lakh people
Summary: Social media users are sharing a claim that Microsoft co-founder Bill Gateshas said in an interview to CNBC that 7 lakh people face death or disabilitydue to the Covid-19 vaccines.

Title: Fact Check: No^ Yogi govt will not shut madrasas that do not celebrate Republic Day
Summary: The Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh will shut down madrasas whichdo not celebrate Republic Day on January 26^ according to a viral message onsocial media.

Title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory claims Covid-19 vaccine caused new strain in UK
Summary: India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found that UK approvedPfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine on Dec 2^ and started the vaccinationprocess on Dec 8. The new Covid variant emerged in the UK in Sept 2020^suggesting it has no connection with the vaccine.

Title: Bill Gates^ vaccines and population control make for infectious conspiracy theory
Summary: Social media users are sharing an old newspaper article that highlightsMicrosoft co-founder Bill Gates’s plan to depopulate the world throughforced vaccination.

Title: Fact Check: Viral post claiming death of 17 female docs in Karnataka bus crash is misleading
Summary: Social media users have claimed that as many as 17 female professors from JJMMedical College in Karnataka’s Davangere district who were on a trip to Goadied in a fatal bus mishap.

Title: Fact Check: No^ Modi govt is not introducing 'one nation^ one power tariff' law
Summary: A message circulating on social media claims that India may be headingtowards a uniform power tariff policy. India Today Anti Fake News War Room(AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.

Title: Fact Check: Video of truck that caught fire goes viral with misleading claims
Summary: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the incident tookplace not in Hyderabad but on Warje bridge in Pune over a month back.

Title: Fact Check: This ‘Islamophobic’ news headline about Kerala cricketer Azharuddeen is fake
Summary: An apparent screenshot of a news headline saying “Kerala born Muslim boyblasts Mumbai” has gone viral.

Title: Fact Check: Hima Das has not yet qualified for the 2021 Tokyo Olympics
Summary: Social media users are sharing a post claiming that India’s sprintsensation Hima Das has qualified for Tokyo Olympics 2021.

Title: Fact Check: Old image of animal rights campaign viral with misleading claims
Summary: A picture has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows a womanportraying a bird injured by the flying kites during Makar Sankranti.

Title: Fact Check: No^ this is not a rehearsal by protesting farmers for January 26 tractor rally
Summary: The video in question is from a charity event held in Germany in December2020 and has been circulating on social media even before farmers announcedthe tractor rally.

Title: Fact Check: Avian flu conspiracy theory linking bird deaths to Jio 5G trial
Summary: Several social media users have alleged that the recent deaths of birdsreported from across the country are the result of 5G tests conducted byReliance Jio and not a bird flu outbreak. India Today Anti Fake News War Room(AFWA) has found that the Centre has so far not approved 5G trials in India.Watch this video to know more.

Title: Fact Check: No board exams in Bengal this year? Mamata’s edited clip goes viral
Summary: According to a clip going viral on Facebook^ West Bengal Chief MinisterMamata Banerjee has announced that students of classes 10 and 12 do not haveto appear for state board exams in 2021 and they’ll be promotedautomatically due to the pandemic.

Title: Fact Check: This is not an Australian astronaut jumping from spaceship to Earth
Summary: A video along with the claim that it shows an Australian astronaut jumping toEarth from a spaceship in four minutes is circulating on social media.However^ AFWA has found the claim to be misleading

Title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory on bird flu linking bird deaths to Jio 5G trial goes viral
Summary: Several social media users have alleged that the recent deaths of birdsreported from across the country are the result of 5G tests conducted byReliance Jio and not a bird flu outbreak.

Title: Fact Check: Viral post on 'Made-in-India' Signal^ Sanskrit coding is a work of satire
Summary: Several claims are doing the rounds on social media that said Sanskrit codingwas used to develop Signal^ a cross-platform encrypted messaging service.India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the entire messagewas initially posted on Reddit as satire^ which was later picked up by manysocial media users who thought it to be true. Watch this video to know more.

Title: Fact Check: Old image of assaulted woman goes viral targeting 'Beti Bachao' campaign
Summary: A set of two pictures showing a woman bleeding from the head and surroundedby policemen has gone viral with the claim that this is the real face of theNarendra Modi government's "Beti Bachao" campaign. This 2016 picture is fromMainpuri in Uttar Pradesh when the state was under Samajwadi Party rule.

Title: Fact Check: Viral post on 'Made-in-India' Signal^ Sanskrit coding is a work of satire
Summary: Several claims are doing the rounds on social media that said Sanskritcoding was used to develop Signal^ a cross-platform encrypted messagingservice. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the entiremessage was initially posted on Reddit as satire^ which was later picked upby many social media users who thought it to be true.

Title: Fact Check: Old pictures of air mishaps linked to Indonesia plane crash
Summary: A post circulating on social media has a set of four pictures apparently ofrelief operations in the aftermath of the crash. India Today Anti Fake NewsWar Room (AFWA) has found that of the four pictures^ only one is related tothe recent plane crash in Indonesia.

Title: Fact Check: This baby was not aboard the Indonesia flight that crashed
Summary: A picture of a baby in life jacket and surrounded by people has gone viral onsocial media with the claim that the toddler has survived the Indonesia planecrash. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the baby wasa survivor from a boat that sank off Indonesia's Selayar island on July 3^2018.

Title: Fact Check: Two-year-old clip of man blackening Hindi text on signboard linked to farmers’ stir
Summary: A video of a turbaned man blackening the Hindi text on a signboard iscirculating on social media with the claim that it is from Punjab^ and thereal agenda of farmers’ protest is to oppose Hindi and Hindus.

Title: Fact Check: Obama never warned Africans against Covid-19 vaccines from US^ Europe
Summary: A message circulating on social media says former United States PresidentBarack Obama has warned Africans not to accept vaccines that will come fromAmerica and Europe. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found thatthere is no official trace of any such statement by the former US President.

Title: Is this farmers-protest supporter a phony ex-soldier?
Summary: A Sikh man claiming to be an Army jawan in a viral video says he was labelleda terrorist for supporting the protesting farmers at Delhi border.

Title: Fact Check: Visualisation of a project in Belgium passed off as swanky Ambedkar library in US
Summary: Pictures are being circulated on social media of a building^ claiming that itis a library in the US named after Dr BR Ambedkar.

Title: Fact Check: Know the truth behind Google's 'self-driving' bicycle
Summary: A video of a "self-driving" bicycle passing through the roads of the city isviral on social media with the claim that it is a revolution in cycleinvention by the American tech giant Google. India Today Anti Fake News WarRoom (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading.

Title: Fact Check: No^ Centre has not removed the nationality column from Indian passports
Summary: The official spokesperson to the Ministry of External Affairs confirmed toIndian Today that the nationality column is maintained in all traveldocuments including the passport^ issued by the Indian government.

Title: Fact Check: Is this an aerial shot of farmers protest ground at Singhu border?
Summary: An aerial view of hundreds of tents on an open ground is circulating onsocial media with the claim that this is how the "world's largest protest" -the farmers' agitation - looks like.

Title: Fact Check: Ex-Army man's video in support of farmers' protest shared with misleading claims
Summary: In a viral video^ a Sikh man who claims to be an Army jawan is heard sayingthat he was labelled a "terrorist" for standing with the protesting farmersat Delhi border.

Title: Fact Check: This 'SSC' notice on new 'Tier-0' level exam to deal with server woes is fake
Summary: Some social media users are claiming has been claiming that the StaffSelection Commission (SSC) has introduced a new 'Tier-0' level exam to dealwith heavy traffic on its servers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA)has found that the notice which is being circulated on social media in thename of SSC is morphed.

Title: Fact Check: This Batman wanted to save the city^ but the video is not from Capitol Hill
Summary: A video of a man dressed in Batman suit started circulating on social mediawith the claim that this was how one of the protesters arrived at the USCapitol Hill along with Donald Trump supporters who stormed the building onJanuary 6. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that theviral clip is from last year.

Title: Fact Check: After Capitol Hill siege by Trump supporters^ Merkel’s parody tweet goes viral
Summary: In the message attributed to German Chancellor Angela Merkel^ she says thather “departure from office is going to be very boring”^ in an apparentreference to the Capitol Hill violence.

Title: Fact Check: Picture of 2013 Kumbh Mela gathering passed off as farmers' protest
Summary: An aerial view of hundreds of tents on an open ground is circulating onsocial media with the claim that this is how the "world's largest protest" -the farmers' agitation - looks like. India Today Anti Fake News War Room(AFWA) has found that the picture used is of the 2013 Maha Kumbh Mela atPrayagraj.

Title: Fact Check: Fake 'National Geographic' magazine cover featuring farmers' protest goes viral
Summary: An image that looks like a magazine cover with "National Geographic" writtenon it^ along with a picture of a man wearing a turban^ has gone viral withthe claim that the cover story of the magazine features the ongoing farmers'protests at the Delhi border. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) hasfound that the said cover image is actually an imaginary artwork by anInstagram user.

Title: Fact Check: Placard seeking release of Kashmiri separatists is not from farmers' protest
Summary: A picture of a young man in turban^ holding a placard demanding the releaseof separatist Kashmiri leaders^ is viral on social media with the claim thatit is a scene from the ongoing farmers' agitation. A picture of a young manin turban^ holding a placard demanding the release of separatist Kashmirileaders^ is viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene from theongoing farmers' agitation.

Title: Fact Check: Picture of Pride parade from Kolkata goes viral as JNU protest against Hindu culture
Summary: A picture of a woman with some other people has gone viral on social mediawith the claim that these are students of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University(JNU) protesting against Hindu women wearing saree and sindoor. India TodayAnti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture was taken in 2019at a Pride parade in Kolkata.

Title: Fact Check: Farmer seen collapsing on video at Singhu Border has not passed away
Summary: A video has emerged where it has been claimed that a farmer died aftercollapsing at Singhu Border during the ongoing protests. India Today AntiFake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to beuntrue.

Title: Fact Check: Netizens mistake artwork for cloud pattern over Mumbai
Summary: A stunning image^ apparently of mammatus clouds^ is circulating on socialmedia with the claim that the sight was photographed over Mumbai skies. IndiaToday Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be untrue.

Title: Fact Check: Truth behind ‘Mandir Banao’ campaign in Pakistan
Summary: Netizens claim that Muslims in Pakistan have started the ‘Mandir Banao’campaign after a Hindu temple was destroyed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

Title: Fact Check: Fake news of Pakistan pilot urinating in F-16 cockpit shared as Dawn report
Summary: A screenshot^ apparently of Pakistan's leading English newspaper Dawn isviral on social media with claims that a "pilot pissing in the cockpit of PAFF-16 said urine increases efficiency of jets told by Allah in his dream".India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the screenshot isphotoshopped.

Title: Decoded: What caused extinction of Ice Age animals
Summary: Archaeologists found new evidence that an extraterrestrial body crashed toEarth almost 13^000 years ago that caused the extinction of many largeanimals and a probable population decline in early humans.

Title: Researchers develop method to produce one of the hardest materials in nature: Study
Summary: Researchers have developed a procedure for producing a variety of compoundboron carbide -- one the hardest materials in nature.

Title: Traffic noise affects bird physiology and reproductive health: Study
Summary: As per this new study^ chicks whose parents were exposed to traffic noisewere smaller in size than those from parents that bred in quiet aviaries.

Title: India's Deccan Traps may have helped Earth's ecosystems recover after dinosaur extinction
Summary: Researchers have found details about how the Earth's terrestrial ecosystemsrecovered following the K–Pg event^ which put an end to the reign of thedinosaurs 66 million years ago.

Title: Turning plastic to treasure: Novel method turns plastic waste into lubricants^ cosmetics
Summary: Scientists have developed a new method for upcycling single-use plastics intoliquid products^ such as lubricants^ detergents^ and cosmetics.

Title: Astronomers accidentally discover previously invisible Monster Galaxy lurking in cosmic dust
Summary: Astronomers accidentally discovered a massive galaxy^ dating from the earlyuniverse^ lurking in cosmic dust clouds.

Title: Dinosaur-killing meteorite crashed into the Earth instantly acidifying oceans
Summary: A new study reveals that the dinosaur-killing meteorite that crashed into theEarth 66 million years ago may have instantly acidified the oceans.

Title: This 'artificial leaf' powered by sunlight produces clean gas from CO2 and water
Summary: Scientists have developed an 'artificial leaf' device that uses sunlight toproduce clean gas and could be used to create a sustainable liquid fuelalternative to petrol.

Title: Tiny bellbirds have the loudest mating calls documented yet^ say study
Summary: A study says that Bellbirds' mating calls are the loudest in the world yet.

Title: Scientists discover 6 new lizard species in Western Ghats

Title: Great Barrier Reef coral skeletons to help understand and monitor the environment

Title: Global biodiversity is in crisis^ with topical oceans hardest hit: Study
Summary: Biodiversity loss is happening at a faster rate in the tropical regions ofthe world and the rate of species turnover in marine habitats was double thatfor land habitats.

Summary: The Supreme Court has told state governments that even if a major protest isgoing on^ public roads cannot remain blocked for a long time^ causinginconvenience to people.
